Function Documentation

char* mystrcat ( char *  dest_str,
const char *  src_str 
)

Function mystrcat Function that appends the source string to the destination string. Overwrites the terminating character of the destination string and then adds a terminating character. The strings may not overlap, and the destination string must have enough space for the result.

Parameters:
dest_str String to where the source string has to be appended
src_str String that has to be appended
Returns:
pointer to destination string

const char *  src_str 
)

Function mystrcpy Function that copies the source string to the destination string including the terminating character

Parameters:
dest_str String to where the source string has to be copied
src_str String that has to be copied
Returns:
pointer to destination string

char* mystrdup ( const char *  src  ) 

Function mystrdup Function that duplicates a string and returns a pointer to the duplicate string.

Parameters:
src String that has to be duplicated
Returns:
pointer to freshly-allocated duplicate string or NULL if insufficient memory was available.

int mystrlen ( const char *  src_str  ) 

Function mystrlen Function that calculates the length of the input string, not including the terminating character

Parameters:
src_str String whose length has to be determined
Returns:
length of the input string

char* mystrncat ( char *  dest_str,
const char *  src_str,
size_t  n 
)

Function mystrncat Function that appends the source string to the destination string. Overwrites the terminating character of the destination string and then adds a terminating character. It uses at most n characters from the source string. The strings may not overlap, and the destination string must have enough space for the result. Since the resut is always terminated with the terminating character, at most n + 1 characters are written.

Parameters:
dest_str String to where the source string has to be appended
src_str String that has to be appended
n maximum number of characters that will be copied from source
Returns:
pointer to destination string

char* mystrndup ( const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Function mystrndup Function that duplicates a string and returns a pointer to the duplicate string. Copies at most n characters. If the source is longer than n, only n characters are copied and a terminating null byte is added.

Parameters:
src String that has to be duplicated
n maximum number of characters that will be duplicated from source
Returns:
pointer to freshly-allocated duplicated string or NULL if insufficient memory was available.
